page.syntax: C REGEX_LITERAL_EXTRACT(text as c,RegEx as c[,options as c])

argument.name: text
argument.description: Input to extract dynamic portions from.

argument.name: RegEx
argument.description: Pattern that contains literals and dynamic elements

argument.name: options
argument.description: If regex ranges are included, '+' to extend the range *[link:regex_literal_mask_get function]* regarding the '+' option.

description.p: Extract the literal characters from a decorated string. This processes input that is expected to contain delimiters, stripping out the delimiters, leaving just the data.
This is useful for processing data (removing a mask) before storage.

page.example: ' Remove the 'literal' characters from input , leaving only the dynamic portions. ? regex_literal_extract("1-(800) 451 1018","[0-9]-\([0-9][0-9][0-9]\) [0-9][0-9][0-9] [0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9]") = "18004511018"
